page.title: 17Men's Jobs in Newquay
page.content:
{(Refer to Page 14 for background) { { }There was great diversity in the type of job that the men of Newquay did for a living.
The largest section was associated with the building trade:builders; painter/decorators;carpenter/joiners; masons;plumbers;roofers;etc.(20%)
5% worked for the RAF in some form or another;there were a similar number of teachers and of managers.
Mechanics/Engineers;Technicians/ Electricians;Telephone Engineers each account for about five per cent.
The holiday trade accounted for only 10%;5% were unemployed;5% were drivers;5% in Police/Fire/Ambulance.
